required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Evaluation of the FluidVision Accommodating Intraocular Lens (AIOL)
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Evaluation of the FluidVision Accommodating Intraocular Lens

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and effectiveness of an investigational IOL.

detailed_description.textblock: Eligible subjects will receive the investigational IOL in one eye and be followed at 1 day, 1 week, 1 month, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months, 18 months, 24 months and 36 months post-operation.

primary_outcome.description: Accommodative amplitude is a measure of the ability of the eye to focus from a target that is at distance into a target that is near.
Visual acuity of the eye will be tested with the correction in place.
Adverse events will be collected from time of enrollment to study exit

arm_group.description: FluidVision AIOL implanted in the capsular bag of the eye during cataract surgery

intervention.description: Investigational implantable medical device intended for long-term use over the lifetime of the cataract subject
